intro: Rhododendron × o-murasaki, commonly known as the Japanese rhododendron, is a hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Rhododendron indicum and Rhododendron kaempferi. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it a valuable species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
